articles.title: Pyongyang City Mass Rally Held
articles.content:
Pyongyang City Mass Rally Held
 Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang city mass rally took place at Kim Il Sung Square on Monday to thoroughly carry out the militant tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial and respond to the letter of the employees of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex.
					The square was packed with at least 100,000 citizens.
					
					 Senior party and state officials were among those present there.
					
					 Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea who is chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, delivered a report at the rally.
					
					 He said that the joint New Year editorial called for accelerating the development of light industry once again this year to bring about a decisive turn in the improvement of the people's standard of living and the building of a thriving nation. 
					
					 It is like a militant banner encouraging the entire party, army and all the people to conduct a fresh general offensive, he added.
					
					He underscored the need to speed up the construction of 100,000 flats in Pyongyang and other major projects, spruce up the streets, villages and work sites in a hygienic and cultured manner and turn the capital city into the more beautiful and modern city.
					
					 A letter sent by the employees of the complex to all the working people across the country was read out to be followed by speeches.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam, manager of the Pyongyang Daily Necessities Factory, who spoke on behalf of the workers called on the workers in the capital to channel efforts into the offensive so as to bring about great innovations and leap forward in the production of mass consumption goods in response to the military call of the Party and to the letter sent by workers of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex. 
					
					 Jong Yong Suk, chairwoman of the management board of the Rihyon Vegetable Co-op Farm in Sadong District, who spoke on behalf of the agricultural workers, called on them to boost the per-unit grain output by introducing high-yielding choice seeds, increasing the area for double-cropping and actively applying latest farming methods and technologies including organic farming method. 
					
					 Choe In Sop, secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, who spoke on behalf of the young people called on them to work miracles in the difficult and labor-consuming work sites including the Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station. He also urged them to play a pivotal role in pushing back the frontiers of science and technology in all domains.
					
					 Kim Chol Ho, dean of a faculty of Kim Chaek University of Technology, who spoke on behalf of the intellectuals, underlined the need to register and introduce valuable research achievements as many and as fast as possible and thus dynamically speed up the offensive to put the economy on an indigenous and Juche basis.
					
					 The rally was followed by a mass demonstration.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets to Myanmar State Leader
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets to Myanmar State Leader
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Senior General Than Shwe, Chairman of the Myanmar State Peace and Development Council, on the 63rd anniversary of the independence of Myanmar.
					 Kim, in the message, expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger by joint efforts and wished the chairman and the people of Myanmar greater successes in their work for the independent development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Myanmar
articles.content:
Choe Yong Ri Greets PM of Myanmar
 Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Choe Yong Rim Monday sent a message of greetings to Thein Sein, prime minister of Myanmar, on the 63rd anniversary of its independence.
					 The message wished the prime minister great successes in his work for the stability and prosperity of the country. And it expressed belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop in various fields in the future, too. 
					
					 Meanwhile Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his Myanmar counterpart U Nyan Win.

articles.title: Officials Help Workers in Steel Production
articles.content:
Officials Help Workers in Steel Production
 Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Ministries and national institutions of the DPRK are rendering sincere assistance to the workers in field of steel production. 
					 An intensive transport of scrap iron to the Chollima Steel Complex was made on Monday. 
					
					 Government officials visited the complex, carrying a large amount of scrap iron in trucks, to assist the field of metal industry in hearty response to the joint New Year editorial.

articles.title: DPRK Attaches Importance to Breaking through Cutting Edge
articles.content:
DPRK Attaches Importance to Breaking through Cutting Edge
 Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The joint New Year editorial of the DPRK's leading newspapers calls for continuously intensifying the drive of breaking through the cutting edge.
					 It is an idea of the Workers' Party of Korea that all sectors should, on the basis of experience of having secured supremacy in the CNC technology, surpass in the shortest time the scientific and technical standards the world has reached and take the lead in the age of IT-based economy.
					
					 The Korean people have made signal achievements in the field of ultra-modern science and technologies like information and nuclear technologies. 
					
					 Industrial sectors related to people's living have been put on a modern basis with solid foundations laid for mass-production of steel, fabrics and fertilizers with domestic fuel.
					
					 The Huichon Ryonha General Machine Factory stands in the van of the drive to push back the frontiers of science and technology.
					
					 An intense drive will be launched this year to break through the cutting edge not only in machine-building industry but in all other industrial sectors and not only in central industry but in local industry.

articles.title: 2011 To Be Successful Year in Improvement of People's Living
articles.content:
2011 To Be Successful Year in Improvement of People's Living
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The Korean people have greeted the new year with a determination to bring about a fresh upsurge in the effort for the improvement of the people's living standard.
					Last year General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to many industrial projects throughout the country, including the construction site of the Huichon Power Station, encouraging the people to do their best for the betterment of the people's living.
					
					The cause of building a great, prosperous and powerful country will make steady progress toward the historic milestone set up by him -- this is the conviction the Korean people etched in their hearts last year.
					
					This year's slogan of the Korean people is "Bring about a decisive turn in the improvement of the people's standard of living and the building of a great, prosperous and powerful country by accelerating the development of light industry once again this year!"
					
					The Korean people are determined to celebrate the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung in Juche 101 (2012) with great achievements in the effort for realizing his desire for the prosperity of the nation.

articles.title: Postage Stamps Published
articles.content:
Postage Stamps Published 
 Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK has issued new stamps on the occasion of the New Year Juche 100 (2011).
					 Seen in an individual stamp are letters "Juche 100 (2011)" and "Happy New Year" and a picture of Korean people turning out in the effort to celebrate the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung as the greatest holiday and a significant event of humankind.
					
					 A sheetlet contains pictures of rabbits on grassland.

articles.title: Japan's Sycophant Policy toward US Blasted
articles.content:
Japan's Sycophant Policy toward US Blasted
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The approval rating for Naoto Kan, Prime Minister of Japan, has reached the lowest. The support rate for the ruling Democratic Party of Japan markedly sank as compared with that in the past.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Monday said:
					
					 The fate of the Kan cabinet and the Democratic Party is like a candle flickering in the wind as they are forsaken by the people. This is a natural product of their reactionary, humiliating and sycophantic policy toward the U.S.
					
					 What policy the authorities pursue toward the U.S. and what stand they take toward the issue of the U.S. military bases in Japan, in particular, serve as a barometer of the mindset of the people towards them.
					
					 It is the Kan cabinet that is mulling offering the whole of Japan as an advance base and the most vital stronghold of the U.S. for carrying out its Asia strategy for aggression, while covering huge expenses for transferring the U.S. military base in Futenma to Henoko.
					
					 The Kan cabinet is letting loose a spate of foolish remarks that the presence of U.S. troops in Japan is required for the "security" of Japan. Worse still, it let the SDF stage the largest-ever joint military exercises with the U.S. forces in Japan.
					
					 The above-said policy of the Kan cabinet is tarnishing the image of Japan and bringing damage to its people.
					
					 One is bound to die a dry death if one enforces a sycophantic policy towards the U.S., quite contrary to the people's mind-set. This is a bitter lesson drawn from the history of Japanese politics devoid of independence.

articles.title: Earliest End to Moves to Escalate Confrontation with DPRK Urged
articles.content:
Earliest End to Moves to Escalate Confrontation with DPRK Urged
 Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- If the Korean nation is to pave the way for reunification and prosperity at an early date, it is necessary to put an immediate end to the dangerous moves of the south Korean authorities for confrontation and war going against the trend of the times, said Rodong Sinmun Monday in a by-lined article.
					 Their moves to ignite a war against the DPRK are a basic factor of bedeviling the inter-Korean relations and threatening peace on the Korean Peninsula, the article noted, and went on:
					
					 The dynamic advance of the fellow countrymen for the victory of the cause of independent reunification is facing a big challenge due to the south Korean conservative authorities' anti-reunification policy for confrontation. 
					
					 This policy caused a cool atmosphere of confrontation to prevail between the north and the south. 
					
					 This grim reality calls for putting an end to the above-said policy of the south Korean conservative authorities as they derailed the dialogue and cooperation between compatriots in denial of the inter-Korean declarations. 
					
					 The improvement of the inter-Korean relations and the security of the nation and its peaceful reunification are unthinkable as long as they persist in their dangerous moves for a war against the DPRK.
					
					 If peace is to be ensured on the peninsula, it is imperative to put an end to their reckless moves for confrontation and war, first of all. This is the most urgent task both in the light of the demand of the times and the requirement of the prevailing situation.

articles.title: All Koreans Urged to Strive for National Reunification
articles.content:
All Koreans Urged to Strive for National Reunification
 Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Monday calls upon all Koreans at home and abroad to usher in a new phase of independent reunification without fail this year by further propelling the patriotic movement for national reunification with hope and confidence. 
					 The Korean nation's reunification movement had made long strides despite the vicious moves of separatists at home and abroad last year, the article notes.
					
					 It goes on to say:
					
					 For the Korean nation to achieve the country's reunification at present is the vital demand and urgent task in the June 15 era of reunification which brooks no further delay. 
					
					 It is the unbearable tragedy that the national division has lasted until now since the middle of the 20th century.
					
					 The viewpoint on the nation and the attitude toward independent reunification are a yardstick distinguishing patriotism from treachery. Everyone should take the stand of placing the nation's interests above anything else and subordinating everything to independent reunification. Only then, is it possible to improve the deteriorated north-south relations and achieve the nation's long-cherished desire at an earlier date.
					
					 As patriotism and treachery can never go together, attaching importance to the nation and independent reunification are incompatible with dependence on foreign forces and confrontation in system. Anyone who truly stands for the improved north-south relations and the national unity and prosperity should take the road of attaching importance to the nation and achieving independent reunification, not the road of dependence and confrontation.
					
					 All Koreans at home and abroad should launch a more determined campaign to improve the inter-Korean relations and reunify the country under the slogan "Let all Koreans in the north, south and abroad join efforts and bring a new phase of independent reunification!" set forth by the joint New Year editorial. 
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration are the banner that the Korean nation should hold fast to in vitalizing the movement for the country's reunification this year.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Confrontation Policy Censured
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Confrontation Policy Censured
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Party of south Korea flailed the policy pursued by the puppet government to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK.
					 A spokesman for the party at a press conference on December 27 last year accused Lee Myung Bak of letting loose a spate of bellicose remarks that "it is impossible for south Korea to avert a war if it is afraid of it." Not content with this, Lee went the lengths of shifting the responsibility for the Yonphyong Island shelling incident onto the people, he noted, adding that what the people hope is to solve issues in a peaceful way, not by a war.
					
					 On the same day, the executive chairman of the party, referring to the Ministry of Unification's release of its working plan for 2011, chided the Lee regime for clinging to a highhanded policy only, failing to shape any prospect and policy for cooperation and exchange with the north.
					
					 Underscoring the need for the "government" to lay a foundation for reunification through exchange and cooperation, he termed the act of disregarding this an incompetent and irresponsible behavior.
					
					 He demanded the authorities make a switchover from their present policy toward the north to that of peace, reconciliation and cooperation.

articles.title: Socialist Constitution of DPRK Praised in Britain
articles.content:
Socialist Constitution of DPRK Praised in Britain
 Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- A joint statement was released by British organizations on December 28 last year to mark the Socialist Constitution Day of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
					 They include the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association
					
					 The statement said:
					
					 The DPRK instituted the Socialist Constitution 38 years back, thereby declaring that it is the best socialist system free from exploitation and oppression.
					
					 Being a unique constitution of Juche, it provides a legal guarantee for the socialist construction in the DPRK and lays down a Juche-oriented line and policy on nation-building.
					
					 It stipulates that the DPRK is a revolutionary state guided by the Juche idea and the Songun idea and the state sovereignty belongs to the workers, peasants and intellectuals.
					
					 Unlike bourgeois lawmakers a deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly is responsible for his or her work before the people and is liable to be recalled when he or she lost their trust according to the constitution. 
					
					 The constitution ensures independence and creative nature of the people of the DPRK.
					
					According to the constitution every citizen of the DPRK enjoys all legal rights including the rights to rest, job, free medical service and education something unimaginable in the capitalist countries. 
					
					 December 27 every year is celebrated as the Constitution Day in the DPRK.
					
					 The Socialist Constitution of the DPRK legally guarantees the building of a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation of Juche.
					
					 It also greatly encourages the world progressives in their struggle for independence and socialism.

articles.title: DPRK Anniversaries Observed Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK Anniversaries Observed Abroad
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Events took place abroad to mark the 19th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army and the 93rd birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 They included seminars held by the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions and in Bulgaria, a film show that took place in India and round-table talks in Indonesia on December 24 and 28 last year.
					
					 Films shown included "Arms of Korea".
					
					 The defence industry of the DPRK has turned into a modern and self-supporting one, the modernization of weaponry and equipment of the whole army has been realized at a high level and an all-people and nationwide defense system rounded off under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, said the general secretary of the international alliance.
					
					 The chief of the Bulgarian Group for the Study of the Juche Idea referred to the revolutionary career of Kim Jong Suk in detail, adding that it is her greatest exploit that she provided steady continuity to the Korean revolution.
					
					 The Korean People's Army has grown strong to be an invincible army as it held Kim Jong Il in high esteem as its supreme commander, said the director of the Indian Institute for Foreign Policy Studies, stressing the army of the DPRK would always emerge victorious.

articles.title: Capitalinos juran materializar tareas del editorial conjunto
articles.content:
Capitalinos juran materializar tareas del editorial conjunto
Pyongyang, 3 de enero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 3 en la Plaza Kim Il Sung el acto multitudinario de la capital para cumplir cabalmente las tareas combativas presentadas en el editorial conjunto de este ano y responder a la carta de los empleados del Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek.
					  En la plaza estaban congregados mas de cien mil capitalinos.
					
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los cuadros del partido y el Estado.
					
					El informe de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y secretario responsable del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang.
					
					El editorial conjunto del Ano Nuevo llama a registrar este ano un avance decisivo en el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo y la construccion de una gran potencia prospera dando un impulso mas a la industria ligera, comenzo el orador y prosiguio:
					
					Igualmente, exhorta a todo el partido, todo el ejercito y todo el pueblo a la nueva ofensiva general, sirviendo de bandera combativa.
					
					Hay que acelerar la edificacion de las viviendas para 100 mil familias en la ciudad de Pyongyang y otros importantes objetos y construir en lo higienico y cultural las calles, las aldeas y los lugares de trabajo para convertir esta capital en la mas hermosa y civilizada.
					
					Acto seguido, se dio lectura a la carta remitida a todos los trabajadores del pais por los empleados del Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek y hubo discursos de determinacion.
					
					En representacion de los obreros, hablo el gerente de la Fabrica de Articulos de Uso Diario de Pyongyang, Kim Yong Nam, quien abogo por dar un gran cambio y gran salto en la produccion de articulos de consumo popular al concentrar la fuerza en la ofensiva productiva la clase obrera de la capital en respuesta del llamamiento combativo del partido y la carta del citado complejo siderurgico.
					
					La presidenta de la Junta Administrativa de la Granja Cooperativa Especializada de Verduras de Rihyon en el capitalino municipio de Sadong, Jong Yong Suk, quien accedio al microfono en representacion de trabajadores agricolas, expreso su determinacion de introducir activamente en la produccion buenas variedades, aumentar la superficie de areas de doble cosecha y aplicar dinamicamente el metodo y tecnica de cultivo avanzados como cultivo organico para incrementar el rendimiento por hectarea.
					
					El secretario del Comite de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Choe In Sop, pronuncio discurso en representacion de la juventud.
					
					El subrayo que los jovenes deben crear milagro en los dificiles lugares de construccion como la obra de la Central Hidroelectrica Juventud Songun de Paektusan y la de la Central Hidroelectrica de Huichon y desempenar un papel medular en llevar al nivel maximo las ciencias y tecnicas en todas las ramas.
					
					El decano de la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek, Kim Chol Ho, hizo uso de la palabra en representacion de los intelectuales.
					
					Manifesto su decision de crear y aplicar mucho y mas rapido valiosos exitos de investigacion a fin de impulsar vigorosamente la labor encaminada a desarrollar la economia con materias primas y tecnologias nacionales.
					
					Terminado el mitin, tuvo lugar la manifestacion.

articles.title: RPDC intensificaracampana para conquistar la tecnologia de punta
articles.content:
RPDC intensificaracampana para conquistar la tecnologia de punta  
						
Pyongyang, 3 de enero (ATCC) -- El editorial conjunto de los periodicos Rodong Sinmun, Joson Inmingun y Chongnyon Jonwi, publicado con motivo del Ano Nuevo 100 (2011) de la Era Juche, subraya la necesidad de seguir intensificando la campana para conquistar las tecnologias supersofisticadas. 
					La meta del Partido del Trabajo de Corea es ponerse en la delantera de la epoca de la economia del conocimiento alcanzando en un corto tiempo el nivel cientifico-tecnico mundial en todos los dominios basandose en las experiencias adquiridas al tomar la supremacia en la tecnologia CNC.
					
					Anteriormente, el pueblo coreano ha logrado exitos alentadores, que admiran a todo el mundo, en las tecnologias de punta como la IT y la nuclear. 
					
					En las industrias relacionadas con la vida del pueblo se promueve la modernizacion y se abrieron las perspectivas de producir en gran cantidad el hierro, la fibra y el abono hechos con tecnicas y recursos nacionales.
					
					Al frente esta el Combinado de Maquinaria Ryonha de Huichon.
					
					Este ano, al seguir el ejemplo de ella, el pueblo coreano levantara un oleaje de conquista de las tecnologias de punta no solo en la industria de maquinaria y la central, sino tambien en todos los demas dominios industriales y la industria local.

articles.title: En 2011 se registraran cambios en la vida del pueblo
articles.content:
En 2011 se registraran cambios en la vida del pueblo
Pyongyang, 3 de enero (ATCC) -- El pueblo coreano ha acogido el 100 (2011) de la Era Juche al despedir el ano pasado en que acontecieron magnas transformaciones que le hicieron vislumbrar un porvenir del fortalecimiento y prosperidad.
					El ejercito y el pueblo de Corea, creadores de una epopeya heroica de continuas victorias bajo la vigorosa orientacion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, estan llenos de esperanza en un porvenir aun mas luminoso y de fe en el seguro triunfo en este ano tambien. 
					
					  En el ano pasado, el Dirigente visito el area de construccion de la Central Hidroelectrica de Huichon y otros lugares de batalla de gran ascenso en todo el pais e hizo que la fuerza espiritual de los militares y civiles se explotara al maximo.
					
					  La obra de construccion de una gran potencia prospera continuara imperturbable su avance segun el cronograma historico senalado por el Dirigente. Esta es una conviccion que el ejercito y el pueblo reafirmaron en lo hondo de su corazon en la jornada de batallas del ano pasado.
					
					  El llamamiento combativo del Partido del Trabajo de Corea  "!Registremos este ano un avance decisivo en el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo y la construccion de una gran potencia prospera, dando un impulso mas a la industria ligera!" conmueve ahora a todo el pueblo.
					
					  Esta elevado mas que nunca el impetu del pueblo coreano de convertir el centenario de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung en la maxima fiesta y un acontecimiento trascendental en la historia de la humanidad al pasar a la dinamica ofensiva, al combate de ataque en todos los campos para llevar a efecto el proyecto del Presidente de construir una patria rica y poderosa.
					
					  El pueblo coreano volvera a librar con dinamismo la ofensiva general para mejorar las condiciones de la vida del pueblo y adornara asi excelentemente 2011 como ano de prosperidad en que las masas trabajadoras vivan felices en todos los aspectos.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun comenta la caida de popularidad de Naoto Kan
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun comenta la caida de popularidad de Naoto Kan
Pyongyang, 3 de enero (ATCC) -- Ultimamente, llega al minimo la aceptacion popular del premier japones Naoto Kan.
					Cayo notablemente tambien la popularidad del gobernante Partido Democratico de Japon.
					
					En un comentario individual divulgado este lunes, el periodico Rodong Sinmun senala que el gabinete de Naoto Kan y el Partido Democratico de Japon pierden su terreno masivo debido a su reaccionaria y humillante politica proyanqui.
					
					La aceptacion popular de las autoridades varia constantemente segun la politica de ellas sobre EE.UU., particularmente, su posicion con respecto al problema de bases militares norteamericanas en Japon, destaca el comentarista y continua:
					
					El gabinete de Naoto Kan intenta entregar en bandeja su territorio nacional a EE.UU. como base avanzada y nido mas importante en funcion de la estrategia agresiva sobre Asia de ese imperio, haciendose cargo de los fabulosos gastos necesarios a la mudanza de la base norteamericana de Futenma a Henoko.
					
					En ese contexto, alega la necesidad de mantener a las tropas norteamericanas en Japon para la "seguridad" nacional.
					
					Por otra parte, las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" de Japon libraron junto con las tropas norteamericanas estacionadas en Japon el ejercicio militar conjunto de mayor dimension en la historia.
					
					Debido a la vil y reaccionaria politica proyanqui del gabinete actual, quedo manchada la imagen de Japon y sufren grandes perdidas sus habitantes.
					
					La historia politica de Japon, falta de independencia, ensena una seria leccion de que sera corto el mandato de los gabinetes si estos practican las politicas proyanquis desoyendo la demanda de la opinion publica.
